comment: Professor Chavoshi is an amazing instructor! She explains concepts very clearly and makes complex topics easy to understand. Her teaching style is organized, supportive, and engaging. I feel much more confident because of her class!She is very kind, caring, and truly wants every student to succeed.
Mid-term pachi gand mari. Aako hath andar jato rayo.

She's good @ what she does, a complex class but she sets u up 4 success u gotta b responsible n put in a decent time if you want to do well. Exams r pretty in-depth, she's strict but will keep u honest n u will learn about DBs. Reach out 2 her she'll level with u. People have had a tough time with her if u want good grades u gotta put in the wrk

Highly accessible outside of class via d2l. Gives good feedback. Yes her accent is thick, but nothing a few questions won't clarify. She really cares about where you are in the class. Tests are 2 part (lockdown quiz/assignment). Lectures are better than other professors I've had. She knows her stuff.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Don't take her class. Very thick accent, no personality, won't connect with you at all. Does not fully understand the course material and makes it very hard to understand how you're supposed to properly set up the work environment on your desktop. Prepare to be endlessly lost and completely helpless unless you know all the material in advance.

She doesn't understand the database material she teaches. If it weren't for the premade KSU powerpoints, she'd be completely lost. She needs replacing desperately. She gave us a 700 question review to do over a weekend, AND she demanded we teach ourselves the last two chapters bc its on our final and she didn't get to it. She's god awful
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Good professor, she respond email quickly, but make sure you pay attention to the details when you draw ER diagram and run SQL
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's a nice lady and passing with an A is pretty easy but she's not a good professor. I almost got the feeling that she was teaching herself the material as she went. Her accent is very thick as well and has a bad habit of reading off the slides painfully slow. But with some effort and caffeine to stay awake, you shouldn't have problems passing.

This was my second class with this professor and it was the easiest A I received this semester. Don't take her for 1301!!! Take her for other classes though, as she will make it easy for you to get an A. She's very caring and lenient, and will work with you. She is shy and speaks very poor english, but she does her best. I am taking her again

I took her online for database systems. The concept of the ER diagrams is quite difficult at first. Pay close attention to how they are made. Also ask for help. Once I got over the difficult hump in the class "midterms", the class became a lot easier. Read all of the slides, and do all of the homeworks, and you will get an A in course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took her for online so it was a lot easier. I made an A so that was good. We were taught SQL and data organizing. There is a group project at the end of semester. Lots of homework and reading. Don't read and you won't pass.  Book is not mandatory, don't buy it. Notes are all online and two exams, a group project, and a final. She gives study guid
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Came into this class without any prior programming experience and learned absolutely nothing from this professor. The only reason I passed this class was because I taught myself how to program by reading the entire textbook. Attendance is required for a grade. Lectures are so boring half the class disappears during the second week or sleeps during.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: High recommend that you stay as far away from this class as possible. PowerPoints are useless,uninteresting as a professor, not helpful in any aspect. You will get all the help from the lab assistants who are the true teachers. Test reviews are useless. Came into this class with no new knowledge came out the same way. Highly recommended against her

The teacher had a rough accent that made it very hard to understand. She would be very unclear on what she wanted during the lab. When she did try helping people in the lab, she would usually just write in the code and not explain it. I would definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Class wasn't challenging at all. Make sure you read the text. Weekly assignments and quizzes were a breeze. Easy A.

Her class online was essentially all busy work. Weekly summaries / reviews of professional journal or magazines. Weekly Quizzes and 2 exams. Sometimes she's not exactly clear in her instructions and you end up paying for it due to misunderstandings. She also posts assignments without any due date so you are left to figure that out.

She doesn't really teach, she gets a pre-made power point and just reads straight off of it, she won't let you view them ahead of time meaning she uploads the file when SHE is read to READ it. Someone asked for an example of a foreach loop, and she said for them to look at the previous lesson. THE LAB HANDS ARE THE REAL TEACHERS, THEY ACTUALLY HELP

She speaks broken English, and her teaching style makes it to where you MUST watch what she writes on the board, rather than what's on the PowerPoint (which oftentimes is very vague). Labs are the most helpful part of this course. Reading the textbook is not required, but some material from it is on tests, which you have to study awhile for.

She speaks in broken English, doesn't know proper grammar, reads off of the powerpoints, lectures are long, and do not recommend her to anyone unless you want your GPA to drop.. You will get absolutely nothing from the lectures but more from self study and the labs. I learned way more from the teacher assistant and from tutoring. She isn't helpful.

Would not take Ethics online with her. So many assignments for such a few credit online class. You have to do two half-page journal summaries every week, one on something computer related and the other on a computer related scientific journal, as well as a chapter quiz every week. 3 or more group assignments and 2 on-campus tests.

Ask questions during her office hours and she will give you the answer! Got all A's on Labs and Projects! Her tests come from the powerpoint slides and the labs! Pretty easy if you study which you have to! Note: English is her second language! She knows her stuff, but she is hard to understand

Honestly going into this class I wasn't sure if computer science was for me or not but after having her class it was clearly not for me. Her lectures are long and dry. They'll put you to sleep. She reads straight from the powerpoint with an accent that is hard to understand most times. The lectures are almost word for word the same as the book.
She tries to help if you ask her, but her English is pretty bad. The book is not mandatory to have, but it is extremely helpful.  She reads directly from powerpoints
Very Good.

Her teaching styles are very bland and will put you to sleep, and when you do actually try to listen to her, her English will confuse you. She also reads EVERYTHING off the powerpoint. Her instructions are seldom clear and in broken English, making projects and homeworks a Farsi-English assignment.

This is a terrible professor and I would not take from her again. She is not helpful at all when you asks questions because she can't understand others very well. All she does is slowly read off the powerpoints in lectures. 1301J was easy but she made it hard to bear.

Absolutely awful. Not clear on anything explained in class, accent is easy understand so not like that is a problem. All she does is read off the powerpoint and when you ask a question points at the slide and says "that is how it is done" no explanations at all! I recommend you avoid her completely I learned absolutely nothing from her.
